content.full_text: Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to Charles R. Matheny, 3 June 18341
paragraphs: Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to Charles R. Matheny, 3 June 18341

footnotes.text: 1Charles R. Matheny wrote the document; Abraham Lincoln signed his own name.

2In March 1834, Abraham Lincoln signed apetitionrequesting  theSangamon Countycommissioners’ courtto establish a road leading fromSamuel Musick’s ferry toNew SalemandJacksonville. The court appointed Lincoln and two others to locate the road, and in June 1834
                  they presented aplan and mapof the proposed route to the county commissioners’ court.

structured_content.text: Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to Charles R. Matheny, 3 June 18341
